My mother's Sope was delicious. As was my brother's quesidilla.   Now their drinks were absolutely amazing. I got the watermelon agua de frescas and I am still dumbfounded on how they made this. It looked like they took a hunk of watermelon, put it in a glass, and served it. But the description says there is also water and sugar. It was big, flavorful, and refreshing. I think that the drink is what a desert oasis must be like.   I will highly highly recommend coming here. I highly highly recommend getting the torta del rey. I highly highly recommend getting the watermelon drink. This was one of the best meals I have ever had. I recommend before you die and for your soul to come have a meal here. This was thoroughly good.

XMQxUEFCuf5sj7zwJxd_fg.text: Really good - Really HUGE sandwiches!! I'm a big dude and I couldn't finish it all! Very good selection, servers were nice too - the only negative was they push these giant margaritas that are pretty pricey yet, no booze! It's in no way a deal breaker but our server did not mention it - we had to ask...  Stop in - you will enjoy it!

-KSgLov-8oQO2geafwMyrg.text: The yummiest Tortas around!!! The salsa verde is so scrumptious, and the service is impeccable. Thank you for a great meal and great service. Please do not change!

3tL1eFar59m6nKEVgrMF7g.text: Saw this from Man vs Food and had to try it. I like the mountainous tortas with a long list of ingredients. We came and had about a ~30 minute wait.  I tried the torta del rey, which was a giant sandwich. So many different meats and a decent flavor. I think having so many toppings might be overkill but I like the novelty.  Decent sized place and it looks like it's always busy. I'd like to get the King Carlos torta, just to see it and split it. There were also lots of regular mexican foods on the menu that I'd like to try, but I had to get the famous tortas for my first time.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta del rey
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta del rey

m2KeqPswgoDI9VORDQiyDw.text: BEST tortas EVERRRR!!!!!  Nortena- steak- no avocado, no jalapenos, no chipotle sauce & extra chipotle mayo & hot sauce...... I promise you will fall in love!!!!!

32rDvocdQyW9nOK6ZHb14g.text: Yay!  I'm still a fan and I think this Torta is "As good as it Get's!! If your craving a really tasty torta, Mexican sammich, you can not beat Los Reyes De La Torta, aka the Mexican Sammich King!!   The shrimp ceviche is DELISH!!  They have a super duper salads also for a great app or as a meal.  But it's the torta's that I come here for!!  Yes they have loads of other things on their menu you can choose from if your not a torta kinda person, but then I would ask; "why are you here?  Seriously?"  :-)  The Torta Del Rey is crazy tasy but ginormous!!  You better have a HUGE appetite or plan to share this with a friend.  They still throw everything on this bad boy but the kitchen sink : -)  I would also suggest their Ranchera de pollo o res with either grilled chicken or steak, guac, fresh cheese, chopped onion & cilantro & a chipotle dressing.  or their Nortena de pollo o res with either grilled chicken or steak, onions & jalapenos with chipotle sauce, melted cheese, refried beans, tomato, avocado.    It's all good at Los Reyes De La Torta!!  I hope you give them a try if you haven't already!!  I'm looking forward to my next visit so I can try their new torta, King Carlos V.  It looks AWESOME!! I hope to see you there.

66t9R-vKIh_G31K0kcg0Pw.text: I love the food! The ceviche tostada is so delicious and inexpensive! I've had several of the tortas, the salads... the aguas, liquids, and everything is good....

XijpeqMtSVZqCZxN_YRgug.text: Best Fresas Con Crema (strawberries and cream) ever!!!! They have walnuts in them and the cream is nice and thick and unlike any strawberries and cream I have ever had. I know they are known for their tortas but I had to give the strawberries a shout out! Their entire menu is very food and authentic I've been here for breakfast lunch and dinner and I've never been disappointed. I usually order the torta USA which I feel gets overlooked by many but it's my fave. The chocolate Eskimo is something I also always order.

DAh86pbjcCjUMZiv6-8lcQ.text: I was in town for a couple of days and wanted some real mexican food. Being Mexicano my self and used to real Mexico City style food, I am very picky. This place delivered.  It took me a while to order because the whole menu looked good. I had a quesadilla made with corn masa and stuffed with Bistec Cebollado.  This thing was big. It was amazing. It reminded me of Mother In Laws cooking.  The Aguas frescas are the best compliment to the meal.  I had Melon (Cantaloupe).  Service was prompt and very nice.  I definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Agua de Melon or Fresh Canteloupe water/juice. Not sure how to translate properly in English
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla con Bistec Encebollado. Damn thing was 12 inches long. It was delicious.

_Fnqfo0YV0xzHTGsFRmoKQ.text: What's a torts?  Flipping tasty is what!  Yummo   It's a burrito on a bun and wow is it ever good. The soapas are very good too but kinda bland.

7pMxFx9m9UpJ4LZQrEM30A.text: This place is always good. My favorite waitress is Veronica. Very attentive and always pleasant. Authentic food. Can't go wrong with these guys!

xwYAn0MvpkWERoERJnhP0A.text: Great atmosphere and authentic Mexican food. My burro was to die for with unique flavors for a carne Asada. The staff and food was excellent.

2AVmFiAgKR8MueNGm3TixQ.text: My cousin has been talking about this place for years never get a chance to go by here even though I  Even though I drive by here all the time I must say  Wish I went sooner  Really  good aguas  and the best   quesadilla mushroom onions and a bunch of other veggies cook crispy tortilla the all the people were friendly  Definitely a new place to go I will be back very soon

cYa0_o5FTp-LqefAYe2Xeg.text: I stumbled across this place because it was close to my old job. It looks questionable from the outside, but it is far from that inside. I am not a fan of Mexican burritos because something about the tortilla ruins it. This places has the most delicious Asada burrito which comes with beans, pico de Gallo, cheese, & avocado inside. They also give a side of cucumber & roasted onion/jalepeno, with lettuce. The burrito has so much flavor! It also doesn't get greasy and make the tortilla soggy. The customer service is always excellent. I love it so much that I haven't tried other things on the menu, but I will.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dY0Cw0wX04IbmStbW-9N2A.text: The food was delicious, the portions were huge, the service was friendly and attentive and the prices are very good. Ten out of five stars

CrJIk899Wt70gVNpSYpNNg.text: If you're looking for a sandwich for lunch, and on the Mexican side of flavors, you're looking for Tortas. This place caught my eye when I was thinking of what to eat for lunch the next day since I was in town for a conference. I think this place is definitely a lunch spot and popular among locals as when we went we saw this place pretty packed. The tortas came out pretty fast and let me tell you, the tortas are big. If you get their signature sandwich, the Del Rey, you will get a surprise of a torta full of different types of meats. This restaurant was featured on Man vs Food, and they make it apparent as there's a huge encased poster on the side of the wall.   Let's get to what I thought of their tortas. I got the Del Principe. Why did I not go all out for the Del Rey, their signature torta? When I read it on the menu, it just seems that there were so many flavors in the torta that it just would conflict with each other. I definitely wished that they offered a Al Pastor torta, but to my sadness I was disappointed that there wasn't one on the menu. So, ultimately what caught my eye was the Del Principe  which was easier to make sense as far as what they put in the sandwich. And I was correct when the sandwiches came out, as my other colleagues got a different sandwich I got to check out the Del Rey torta. That thing was massive, but for me it was nice and manageable.   I wouldn't say that this torta was the best I've ever had, as I've had some amazing rotas. I was just a little saddened that they did not offer an Al Pastor as one of the options of meats. However, for what they have and their twist on tortas and style I definitely recommend it if you're interested in trying something new. If you want a ton of flavors all at once I definitely recommend the Del Rey torta, however if you're looking for something simple where you can enjoy it, check the Del Principe out and see what you think. Sadly, I went restaurant hopping so I went to different places every day of the week so I didn't get to try out the other options. I definitely recommend here for lunch and tortas!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Del Principe

7vxqulwvWr1IqN9nrAG-tA.text: I'm sure you have heard of this place. I have been coming here since I was 10years old and the vibe might be changing, but one thing that doesn't change is, the traditional flavor they have kept up with very well, if anything it gets better and bold. The staff is very welcoming, amazing at tending the customers, making sure your order is out to your table on time, and if your kid makes a mess, you will have everyone helping you out. Thank you everyone at Los Reyes!

wnNv0L3oUp696NlstCJXGw.text: Lately this hasn't been as good as it used to be. Plenty of places to eat, choose those who stay consistent, and fresh. People get lazy, that's how they go by the wayside

ZgNBTiAR0o47wlmGxwPONw.text: The atmosphere is great, the workers are friendly, and the food is da bomb. Very authentic and very tasty. Depending on the hours and days the service might be a tad slow, but it's worth the wait. Try one of their Agua Frescas or save some room for the Tres Leche Cake.

hGNWHivNufTKdIoweYhmMA.text: My friend Bill and I decided to come down here and check this spot out.  I have had it bookmarked for awhile now, and decided to knock it out this past Friday.    We both went with their signature sandwich, The Torta Del Rey.  I went with a full, and Bill went with a half.  This torta comes loaded to the brim with, to put it blunt, a shitload of stuff!  This thing comes with ham, melted cheese, pork sirloin, breaded beef, omelet, sausage (hot dog) and Mexican sausage (chorizo), tomato, onions, avocado, chipotle sauce and a smear of refried beans.  Yes, all that stuff comes on this beast!  It is served with a side of Ruffles chips.  Here is how it was.............  Torta Del Rey- Wow!  This thing was massive!  It was incredibly visually appealing!  I took a bite into it, and was pretty satisfied.  Even though there are a ton of meats in this sandwich, you could pretty much pick out each individual flavor.  I liked that aspect of it.  I didn't like a few things either, though.  First, the sandwich was just way too damn hot.  I should have let it sit for a few minutes. Second, I would probably get it without the hot dog and sausage.  They wrapped those up in the omelet/egg.  I wound up taking off the egg pocket on my 2nd half of the sandwich.  Even with the chipotle sauce, it was still a bit dry.  I ate the whole thing, along with the chips, and was stuffed to the brim.  Wasn't great, wasn't horrible.    Overall, I was glad that I made it down here.  I don't know if I would order the Del Rey again.  I would probably try out something else, something more simple like a plain carne asada torta.  I think I almost set myself up for failure though, too.  I have had many tortas from Wash Mobile Tortas down in Tijuana, and those are the best, and my all time favorites.  No other torta can compare. Service was friendly.  The price was a bit steep though, too.  The sandwich was huge, but even then, I don't think it justified the almost $14.00 price tag (after tip) for lunch.  Am I coming back?  Yeah, someday I'm sure I will make it back down here.  I'm not rushing to get back though.  A-OK.  3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta Del Rey- Massive!  Good but not great.

DIlCcCDeYwG1Mraei3E6Fg.text: This place was amazing. If you like tortas you will think you've died and gone to heaven. Warning, the full size torta is huge, big enough for 2 people. My wife had enchiladas and said her dinner wasn't great. I had the Del Rey Torta and it was amazing. I will stick with the tortas and will definitely be back.

GrLy8vIa4CAcgja5XD4vgA.text: This is truly an immersion into real Mexican food. The inside is not fancy with eclectic art or artifacts from Mexican history. There is no alcohol served here. Imagine that, dinner without booze!   The preparation and plate displays nothing but authenticity. It is not located in a great neighborhood and those stuck up Biff and Erma from their high ended plot need not venture here. This is for real down to earth people that accept all cultures.  Our meals were excellent and the price just right. Don't worry, they do speak English if that was your concern. A very family driven establishment. We will be back soon! #vinosquared #vino2 #vino2ultimate

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3LmFuJ4X1-vzXshSQ8hgGA.text: Used Yelp to find this place to take my dad and his squeeze. Ratings showed that this place was the one to beat and they did not disappoint. Very simple seating, nothing fancy. Wait staff was very friendly and made good recommendations to us. I had one of the tortas and it was amazing! I'm surprised tortas aren't more of a thing to the general Mexican-American culture because they are so good! I'm expecting to get one at Burger King someday. Anyway, this place was great and we were very, very pleased with the food. Would definitely go back!!

vYpuV2ND5M-hz8wR4pagJQ.text: This place is amazing. Food is delicious! I always order the shrimp ceviche, taco asada, and their mango smoothie. I tried their quesadilla and it was good too. Don't let the outside appearance of this restaurant discourage you. Yes it is small and can appear sketchy. When you go inside, it has authentic Mexican ambience with a bit of local AZ atmosphere. The servers are bilingual and have good customer service. They can get crowded during busy hours, but my girlfriend and I absolutely love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Asada Taco
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango agua frescas (kids size)
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp ceviche

UCeQxoF7D_rZxkO1mObwXQ.text: What a great "find". I must have driven by Los Reyes hundreds of times and never set foot inside. My loss until now. The restaurant is simple and straightforward. No alcohol, but let me tell you: the lemonade is awesome so no complaints about not having a margarita with the meal. This family-owned business is all about the food and the attentive and friendly service.   Once seated we ordered some refreshments and, after deciding on our order it wasn't even 5 minutes before they arrived; and the portions were, lets say, generous. Wow. I ordered the Torta del Rey. It's huge. And really delicious. Layers of assorted meats including bacon. Truthfully, I would have had enough with just one half and saving the other for lunch the next day. The price is more than reasonable given the size of the portions. This place is an amazing value for what you get and you will not be disappointed. Check it out. I definitely will return.

C8aOlO6dPG9uTDNskVtBag.text: Stellar Mexican food. They own the paneceria next door, so the bread on each Torta is fresh. Lots of different options of tortas that average about ten bucks each. Great place. No alcohol license but they allow you to bring your own in if you wish, which is cool. And they have different dishes besides tortas. Highly recommended for an delicious, laid-back place to grub that's affordable.

uyiNiWPspL2Kt54IVuThrA.text: Awesome somethered tortA. I got it to go soooo I'm betting it's even better to eat there!

kSx8DSYR4ysnsVnnXi9Dcg.text: I had to leave because the host seated people who got there after we did. She seated them n told  them o I made a mistake but that's ok. It seemed like she knew them. She was talking to them n laughing..that's not right. my kids were hungry and she did it again after we were told they had a table almost ready. I will never go there again.

goj4Al8jyuoaU0WwCtnAbA.text: This place is awesome.  It's a little tough to get to due to how cave creek and 7th St merge but once you find it, it's a gem.  I always get the same thing, the nortena torta with chicken.  The Mexican sandwich is marinated grilled chicken with jalapeno and onion tossed in. They then top it with Jack cheese, avocado and a chipotle cream sauce. It's incredible.  The bread is super soft and light.  My favorite item here is the orange salsa.  It's sweet with a little touch of heat, I could honestly drink the stuff.  I ate there with a buddy and we went through like 5 of the little dishes, it's insanely good.  My understanding is there authentic drinks are very good too but I haven't tried them personally. The service is always spot on.  This is one of the better sandwiches in Phoenix!

fmHvIeeDaqFzoN4bIn6RSQ.text: If you've ever been an inebriated bachelor and piled whatever you found in your fridge in between two slices of bread or into a tortilla,  or perhaps a struggling mother who feeds her family a hearty mash-up of Whatever once a week on Leftover Night,  then you'll appreciate "The King of the Sandwiches".  Don't be afraid of rubbing elbows with your fellow patrons, or of a little grease running down from your overstuffed-torta-compressing hand all the way to that elbow.  Try somethign that sounds loco -- it won't be that hard.  A couple of the choices contain basically everything you could think of to put on a sandwich, and then some.  Actually, you could get a single sandwich that contains the innards of about a half dozen sandwiches all at once.  Epiphany~  LRDLT's Del Rey and Las Reynas sandwiches are essentially the Turduken of torta shop tortas.  Enjoy your hotdoghamchickenfriedsteakchickenfriedchickenchorizocheeseavocadoonionporkchopeggjalopenoburgerburritosandwich

7w-yxky-F5RR4K5oRCPxXA.text: I had seen this restaurant on yelp and decided to give it a try. I'm new to the area here for a short time trying different places. The service was good the atmosphere was welcoming. I thought the asada torta I had was tasty but I wouldn't say it was the best I've ever had. The meat was seasoned well but I prefer it chopped instead of sliced.  The chicken tacos were so so. I will be visiting again to try other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A lot of torta

nhr-OiXHcTGo2dRcWzKeYA.text: Thank you Man Vs. Food for introducing us to this place. This was our first dinner stop on our little vacation in Phoenix. Be forewarned this place does not have any curbside appeal, and we actually ran into some shady people on the way in. But the appeal is in those huge tortas. We opted for the original Del Rey torta and an amazing Aguas Frescas and Pina Colada. The drinks are HUGE! The tortas are even bigger. The only down side is their Ruffle-like side of chips they serve. I mean can't we at least get some tortilla chips or something. Throw us a bone here.  Other than those horrible chips, everything else is amazing. The flavor of meat in the torta is unbelievable. And make sure to order an Aguas Frescas. So refreshing and so ginormous. Try this place if your are in AZ. It is a must!

yrooL5GjrZj5C-wVwjXTBw.text: Delicious and inexpensive and in the part of town where I was at the time. The Man vs Food endorsement didn't hurt.

w-Kaa94GIpe1-b4u6HrWdg.text: I've been here twice now, both times I ordered one of their Tortas and both times I was definitely satisfied with my meal.  The first time was a few months ago and I tried the Tortas Del Rey; their signature torta.  This thing is absolutely HUGE!  Everything in the torta was cooked perfectly and the service was excellent.  The next time I ordered something new on the menu called the Torta Nortena. This torta has grilled steak, grilled onions, jalapenos, cheese, avocado and a mayo chipotle sauce that made the sandwich extremely tasty.  I am looking forward to the next time at Los Reyes, this food hits the mark!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta Norteña with grilled steak and chipotle mayo sauce...

e_2N2lifb4rf5CmOg6kkMw.text: I actually liked the atmosphere of this quaint divey restaurant.  It reminded me of my 20s when I used to go to mexico for the day, or even for the weekend.  Growing up in San Diego, the border was a quick 10-15 minute drive.  We came here because it was featured on a television show.  The thing to order was the Del Ray Torta.  So we ordered that and the King Steak Tacos.  I thought the Del Ray was ok.  Each of the meats in it were tasty in its own right, BUT there was too much going on.  Like a pretty girl overly made up or like if you got all flavors of ice cream and blended it all together.  Tastes and looks good but not distinctive.  I took a few bites, was like..OK..yea.. um, sure..its good..another bite..hmph..nod.. I guess i was really trying to like it.  Now the King Steak tacos Suprised me!  A little on the greasy side, they were tasty and filling, with a price that was pretty decent for the amount of food on my plate.  I finished every last bite!  Service was indifferent.  Neither friendly nor unfriendly; They were there to do their job, which they did efficiently.  It was pretty busy, but things came out at a timely manner.  I don't think any of the waitresses eat the food here.  Every single one of them were in great shape, even the older ones.  I was envious.  I would return to try out another torta, and perhaps one of their delicious looking drinks.

wKnT9wxuOQGZP90INK9_dQ.text: Great friendly service & fresh food. Been here multiple times and will continue to come back. Great menu

T_mrLQlGd3JebkPpxl5Vjw.text: I was quite excited to go here based upon all the reviews on Yelp and by friends but was a bit disappointed.  We only ordered the Fortas and there was very little meat compares to the bread sizes. While the salsa was tasty it wasn't very filling or satisfying.  Their "chips" we're Ruffles. Overall maybe would consider it if I had a coupon and would try something else

1juapt-lycfv8L-jZGziwg.text: This place is AMAZING. My husband and I ordered the Hawaiian torta and I ordered horchata and we both LOVED it all. The tortas are pretty large, and I'm glad we read that they were a sharable size, since we weren't all that hungry.  Wish so much we had tortas like this one in Colorado.. will definitely be going back when we get back to Phoenix!

qa5t0KgCzmGDccImE9ULMQ.text: For as much hype as this place got from my friends I was expecting some sort of flavor explosion to occur when I ate here. Instead what I got was a wait in a place with limited AC in AZ in the sumer for what was essentially a ton of different meats that weren't seasoned much thrown on a bun.   While the torta I got, the del-rey, wasn't bad it also wasn't fantastic. It tasted like what it was a hodge-podge of meats one would find in mexican food all thrown on a bun. It was hard to distinguish any significant flavors and the one I got the most was that of hot dogs.   I probably would have held this place up a bit higher if I hadn't gone to a torta place near work a few days later and had a very similar sandwich that actually had some distinct flavor and I didn't have to wait with little AC for it.  I might try this again if I lived closer but I am not driving out of my way for this.

UFZKuq1j8AfilqlzlCwEcQ.text: It seriously doesn't get much better than this when it comes to Mexican cuisine in North-Central Phoenix.   After hearing about this place on Man Vs. Food (as I'm sure many others did), a bunch of us were inspired to try the Torta Del Rey during lunch one day. This thing is monstrous! The size is incredible, and the taste is out of this world! I ate half of it and had to take the rest with me to eat later in the day.   Other than the epic Torta Del Rey, this little restaurant is just one of those great hole-in-wall places that has the best food in the area. If you're in SunnySlope for the artwalk, stop by this place before-hand and see how far you can get into the King of the Tortas!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta del Rey (King of the Torta)

Xo_97CLTFuUi0S9OfkKjwg.text: Huge portions, recommend splitting a meal.  Authentic Mexico City food.  I recommend the carne asada burro with green sauce and a Mexican Coke.  It's in a sketch area of town for a gringo like myself, but so what.  The Pina Colada is by far the best one I have ever had in my entire life.  The fruit juice bar is no joke.

aFuWmHTwh-P-miaXv7F5Ew.text: Del Ray Torta was big and flavorful.  Everyone loved the agua fresca!

9s2MgeNSpFxqlB5wQPbYYw.text: I've been living in Phoenix for about two summers and I can confidently say these are the best tortas I've ever had. Although the atmosphere is somewhat loud and the wait can be long during busy hours, the wait is always worth it. The staff is very friendly and you can never go wrong with any of the dishes you pick. If a torta is a mouthful, their quesadillas with handmade tortillas are delectable. I also recommend trying out their aguas cremosas made on the spot. This is one of the few places in the area you can he a delicious, full meal for an affordable price.

KFki-0kwb7-vV8HWhBKJLw.text: I have always loved Tortas and had been wanting to try out this place. First of all,  the service was exceptional and I felt like I was actually in Mexico. The food came super fast and it was delicious! The potato chips, however were not homemade as I've had in other Torta restaurants. That is the only reason I didn't give them five stars. Overall, I enjoyed my lunch. I ate the Mexican Torta (mini) perfect portion size and adequately priced. I will be back for more!

J-hKMaYHrkFfFboQRo3uEg.text: I quickly found a parking right in front of the restaurant. I could smell the food instantly. I walked in at noon and was seated immediately in the main room where the kitchen is. I noticed two additional rooms - one to the left that looked like more of a party room with a bar and one room to the right that had a big screen TV in it. The staff was very helpful. I ordered the 3 King Tacos for $8.99. You get your choice of chicken or steak, not both.  The meal is served with guacamole and rice or salad. The orange sauce they serve on the side is HOT!  Oh yeah, and the waitresses look half-decent, too, on top of their friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken tacos aka King Tacos

7R1jKPRsmEARO2tG-3mlfw.text: Went here with my job and also because it was on Man versus Food.  The food was good however I ate the carne asada torta and had a cantalope drink to wash it all down.  They have some sandwiches that are just plain disgusting looking but beauty is in the eye and mouth of the beholder.  My co-wroker had a sandwish with ham, ground beef, hot dogs, another type of meat, cheese.... you get the picture.  Not my cup o tea but apparently something he wanted.

8ppTfxd4urPg7_MUFIEVkw.text: Where do I begin? I think I had so high hopes for Los Reyes that set the bar too high. I was craving the El Rey and ordered it as soon as I say down. To be honest te torta was just alright. I mean I actually finished it, but I felt like I had to keep eating it to like it more. It was just alright...I wouldn't order it again. I think it just too much going on in the sandwich I couldn't really like it.   Now my wife had the carna asalda tacos and they were very good! I found myself wishing I would have ordered the tacos. 3 giant sized tacos good deal for the price.   I will actually return to Los Reyes. I want to try the chicken torta next time and some tacos too. I wouldn't rate my experience bad here...just average. Hopefully I'll like it better next time not ordering the El Rey!!

JNnEKhLh740r5XFIfT9eCA.text: AMAZING, AUTHENTIC, DELICIOUS. We were craving authentic mexican food This was it! Food was perfect, service was great. We will be going there quite often. LOVED IT!!!!

Seczlo1T_6lbgFgOAyJXlg.text: Another fantastic place I never would've found if it wasn't for Yelp.  I had the Del Ray and Horchata...everything was better than expected.  Great prices, too!

5ZFVm_OWbFpYbMkVpqzFDw.text: !!!!!!!!!  THE BEST  !!!!! CEVICHE TOSTADA ALWAYS A GREAT CHOICE!! Maybe 3 !!!  All the tortas are bomb!!! Cannot say one bad thing about this place. Have been coming for a few years now and will keep on eating!!!  They have another spot on 43rd and Thomas area that we have tried as well and it's just as good!!
