Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wLmtapPORBWcvHZ6hNRBBw.text: Wow! Thanks to Man vs. Food I ate possibly the best torta sandwich ever! The torta del rey had a plenty of meat and the watermelon aqua was to die for. If I was ever was on death row and I had to pick a last meal then the torta del rey would be a top candidate.    Not only was the food mind-blowingly addictive but the service was top notch as well. Our server was not only helpful and fast but she was also extremely courteous and professional.   I only wish that there could be a location somewhere in Los Angeles because then I would go every single week.   Simply put this restaurant is outstanding.  Go, NOW! To unbelievably delicious eatings!! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Del rey torta in the front the norteno de res in the back. With a strawberry milkshake and watermelon aqua

tcvM4cpgnSoZnhTomp67bw.text: I had friends in town and they had seen this place on Man Vs. Food and were dying to go. I have to admit I hadn't seen that episode, so this place wasn't on my radar at all. It's located in a little shopping center and you couldn't tell from the outside, but it was packed and this was just before 11am!  The food looked and smelled amazing as we were seated. My girlfriend and I went for the quesadilla's because frankly everything else looked so HUGE! Her husband got the sandwich that was mentioned on Man Vs. Food - La Reyna, and it looked and smelled awesome! It was massive but he finished every bite (and didn't eat for the rest of the day).  The staff was friendly and the food was good and fast! I will definitely have to bring the Hubby here!

VFDQ5WhCmOnSK1FXUaAUhw.text: This place was beyond my expectations. Friends recommended this restaurant and we decided to try it. Well, we were not disappointed. The service was attentive to our needs. Our waitress was always on top of refilling my husband's drink. After she took our order our food was brought to our table within 15 minutes. The tortas are delicious. There is a vast variety to choose from. These tortas are not your typical asada tortas you get in other places. The meats are very well cooked and they are served plenty. For all of you that don't like spicy just ask them to omit the chipotle sauce, since it is a little spicy. We will definitely come back another chance we get to travel to Arizona.

yDaStLsOMu12PHrxJnTbdg.text: Love love love Tortas!! Amazing food, truly delicious and authentic! A must try! Staff is always friendly and food is consistently wonderful!

VsCQJ5MQ6v6yogh87s1q6A.text: Wonder if this place is in "the square".  If not I imagine this so called square to be similar which I envision as a place where everyday people live.  With all that said the food was excellent and authentic.  Surprised not more of these place in Phoenix.  Great wet burrito and nice selection of tortas.  Mine was excellent with grilled onions a smear of retried beans and a touch of some spicy bite inside.  Service was good and attentive but we did get seated by the ice room.  High traffic with workers walking in and out but it doesn't really matter.  My son and I will be back!

C-2iQUo2zeExl2qhZIfiWw.text: "OK, that kicked ass!"  This is the only sentence I could manage after leaving Los Reyes de la Torta.  The food coma was quickly rendering me incoherent...  This place well, does kick ass.  Muy autentico!  Salsa music in the background and soccer on the TVs.  An extensive menu with portions that seem to only come in one size - ginormous.    We thought we were being so smart by sharing two items.  Yeah, right.  There was enough deliciousness to feed a small family.  Mango juice... served in a chalice with a big slice o' mango riding on the side.  Shrimp quesadilla... I had no idea that tortillas could be made in that size.  Torta Del Rey... Easily more than 5" tall and packed with just about everyting that their kitchen can prepare.  I would love to see someone try to bite into this.  We had to eat it with a fork.  Amusing that the torta is served with potato chips - who has the stomach real estate left to eat those!?  The only thing you can do after a meal like that is crash on the nearest couch until you feel human again.  I will be hungry again sometime late next week.  Ay, lo me Encanta!

CzqIMsfxKz2xc9BYF79LuQ.text: The food was amazing and the service was great!  We ordered the queso fundito with chorizo and jalapenos as an appetizer,  delish (order extra tortillas).  We ordered the Chuleta tacos and they were fantastic!!!  The only down side is there is NO ALCOHOL OR BEER.

_6bFsm81CZiseKN5_ynmTA.text: The first time I went to Los Reyes I ordered the Del Rey (before Man Vs Food)...  That was the last time I ordered it.  I was unaware of what I was getting myself into and was pretty embarrassed when it came to the table.  I definitely should not have ordered 2 of the ceviche tostadas to start!  That being said, the ceviche tostadas were great and for $.99 can't be beat.  The platillo de pechuga asada estan muy bueno, it's really, really good.  I have never been let down by anything I have ordered here.  From the quesadillas to the burritos to the mariscos, everything has been great.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pechuga asada

d08JR7zFN48z1dHAI0oqHA.text: The food was amazing! Best Mexican restaurant ever. This is real Mexican food unlike other places. The servers were lovely and the atmosphere was great. Everyone was friendly .

vX-JGSXRGAlfRebPqpWXdA.text: The first time we ate here i was super excited after seeing this restaurant on Man Vs. Food.  It was very easy to find although there is limited parking.  We were seated right away.  I ordered the Nortena Torta which was filled with Japapenos! Yum.  It was everything i was expecting.  You have your choice of a salad or chips.  My husband ordered the Del Rey which was enormous!  He really liked it as well.  I had a Coca Cola from Mexico out of a bottle which reminded me of eating in Mexico City with my family, although there are no refills.  The waitresses  are very attentive.    The second time we came in we had a great experience as well, but did not really like their Arnold Palmer because it seems that the iced tea is not brewed but a powder drink.  So we sent it back and ordered water instead which they made no big deal out of.  They offer so many different plates and choices. I can't wait to try something new every time i come in.  I can't wait to bring my family here when they come visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastel de tres leches

kdVKfJz-QB4bgFaKlVkA_A.text: I really enjoyed lunch here. The tortas were very unique and delicious! Full of flavor very good combinations. I had a nortena torta, it was packed with avocado and cheese. Yum!! The USA torta was good too.   Our waitress was very friendly. Always smiling and making aure we were doing good.   Boo-hoo no beer is sold but its not a big deal, get an  agua fresca or a liquado instead, those are great as well!  Overall you have to appreciate this place for what it is, a local torta restaurant, well worth the trip!

2Cr92ZcKYP6erw6Itd_ahQ.text: torta with guacamole, ham, breaded pork, meat, more meat, and topped with a fried egg with sides of radishes, cucumbers and ruffled chips!!!   portions are humungous!!! definitely fill you up goooood and make you proud that you just downed the whole torta!  or force you to run 5 miles...  cerviches were delish...nothing skimpy at all on a tortilla chip. guacamole and shrimp were fresh..squeeze of lime=refreshing  quesadilla was huge! stuffed with meat and cheese  drinks are huge as well, pina drinks with a tiny umbrella and pineapple wedge  as for dessert...if you still have room, chocolate flan cake! it was about 15% flan 85% chocolate cake.  top that with whipped cream and a cherry and drooooll......  this place s definitely somewhere to go to splurge and eat it all out! i felt like man vs food trying to finish everything we ordered. they even have this huge torta that is free is you can finish it within 15 minutes......

XSNyWQU7afvHzvGmPConuQ.text: I love this place! I moved here from Anaheim CA about two years ago and I was having a horrible experience finding a Mexican or torta or taco place because most Mexican places I went here in Phoenix is "Sonoran"  or "northern" style cuisine. They make tortas just like the ones in the D.F. city or Cuernavaca Morelos!!! In addition they have Esquimos, which I love (it's a drink) so I've been coming to place at least once a month. It is in a small location parking and wait time is horrible, but we'll worth the wait, that's why I put 4 abd not 5, they NEED a bigger location.  The outside is not very attractive, I almost didn't go in, there's usually a waiting time to be seated. They make the food fresh so it also takes a while. Do not go when your starving because, it does take time! They also gave a "kids menu" the portions on those are a bit big in my 4yr niece only eats 1/4 to 1/2. The tortas comes with "chips" aka ruffle looking salted potato chips like regular lays, or a salad consisting of lettuce and a couple of cucumber slides. I loved that this they served the salad with cut lime, ( just like my mother, they must be from the same place) no dressing so I don't have to worry about telling "NO DRESSING". If you do go, try one of their delicious natural fruit water, they also have fresh juices.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Líquido and torta

_-END42G-E4LgueJ35AZXQ.text: Ewwwww  Are people just giving this place good reviews bc they want to pretend like they're super cool and are totally down with hole in the wall places in the hood??   Bc this was seriously nast. We ordered the queso w chorizo and that was bomb, I'll give them that.  Our food came out, I had one bite of my chilaquiles and was like ready to spit it out. The green sauce was creepy and the steak was very off in flavor and not seasoned at all. I asked for a to go box and boxed up the steak to feed my dogs.   My friend ordered their torta. She was like 'I can't tell if I don't like this bc it's gross or bc I'm full' I tasted it and was like 'bc it's gross.' she called me today to tell me she tried eating it for breakfast but threw it out bc it was nasty.   We'll be sticking to the torta from Gallo Blanco, bc even though their service sucks, at least their torta is amazeballs.   Seriously some of the grossest food I've tasted. The staff was friendly and the place was clean and packed. I just personally find the food super nasty.

OwiktvqEN6J3jLYi9zp-FQ.text: We went to Los Reyes de la Torta last weekend for the first time. I was excited about the food, but wondered if it would be difficult to order and about the standards of cleanliness.   Both concerns were completely unfounded. The staff there were English-speaking and very friendly. The place appeared to be quite clean, too!   We ordered two agua frescas. One was mango and the other was cantaloupe/watermelon on the waitress' recommendation. Wow! Both were so fresh and delicious. Not too sweet, either.   Our sandwiches were the del Rey and the Arizona. They were both huge and served on some really good sandwich buns. I just couldn't believe my eyes when I saw all the stuff they squeezed into both sandwiches! Ham, pork sirloin, chorizo, sausage, egg, avocado, jalapenos, breaded beef-- probably some things I'm forgetting.   Somehow the flavors meld together to create the most savory combination with just a little heat. I had to stop after eating half my sammy due to threat of gastric explosion. Hubby ate the entire del Rey. Guess skinny guys must have a hollow leg where they put giant meals.   I loved my meal. It's the kind of thing you'd see on "thisiswhyyourefat.com" but soooooo worth it. We will be going back and plan to blow our out-of-town guests' minds with this place next time they visit! I forgot to mention our meal was less than $30 including tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Agua Frescas
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Arizona

m451h-q0CXHzUMDBbClsjA.text: Traveling thru Phoenix, wanted some food, but not a chain. Yelp recommended. LOVED IT! Neighborhood joint. Local. Tortas. Sinfully delicious. Generous portions. Reasonably priced. ESPN Desportes (MNF) on the screen. Couldn't AI for more.

fNFWJhDQTm9dbW9FZLdTZw.text: Wow. Biggest Torta ever. I got the Del Rey, and it was ENORMOUS. And delicious. This thing has everything and is as big as my fist (see picture). While the torta is very good (and extremely large) the real star at this joint is the agua fresca. Their agua frescas are absolutely amazing. A giant sandwich and a giant pina, and I was full for 2 days.   I will definitely go back here when I'm in this neighborhood...

CYzSCHPFD_I0qa1cABDl2w.text: Was ok.  My wife enjoyed her Torta. I just wanted a good taco and I ate my whole plate and was still hungry.  I ordered the steak tacos.

tOIUByWgwvs4jkxHyUigNA.text: Does another review even matter?  After Man vs Food, what more?  Food is good, but honestly there are other MX restaurants around that are just as good.  I find the meat to be on the greasy side and I'm not a big fan of hot dog in my torta, but overall I think they hold their own.  The people are really nice.  On the MX restaurant scale it s a 7.5 I'd say.  They serve no chips & salsa which I find odd, but actually they're doing me a favor as those are wasted calories.

kSfB7HN0SuPDB86SvtbTjQ.text: The best torta in a valley where every Mexican restaurant claims to have the best. Magical. Great staff, fast service. Authentic.

qoy7DzwkfyssyOUT0rUxVQ.text: The torta del ray is huge and good, after I eat this huge torta, it was instant food coma. I didn't eat the next day since I was still full. The place is small but clean, staff is friendly.  I will be back when I recovered from my food coma

tRUXwBKndtTEsx18vLQBYw.text: Stopped by for breakfast on Sunday and despite the unassuming exterior found the restaurant and food to be good. I ordered ham and eggs which was good, but not great. My brother got the torta and it was certainly filling and tasty. I can't say it was the best breakfast I've had but was a food home cooked Mexican breakfast which was a welcomed taste of home for a Texas girl living in Georgia.

Cb1bYnpyc_5kxkvfZTeAnw.text: We waited for almost an hour for our food for pick up, we were hoping it was worth the wait since there were so many people and it seemed like everyone loved the food, well I was WRONG! The meat was DRY, the horchata was STALE and tasted BLAND. If you want good Mexican food I'd go to filibertos instead and at least the wait will be far less than an hour. If I could give this place zero stars, I would. Food was just AWFUL.

ZLIpnmIAkK31tsoPyrNObw.text: Chose this place out of all the places available to us in that area. Great idea! Although we sat at an awkward little table by the kitchen, our meals were wonderful.  I had the 2nd from the top of the torta list. It was the regular size, not the small one. I loved it! ahead had the carne milanesa and that was excellent too. The torta had hot dog, ham etc. Only bummer was that they had to use guacamole instead fresh avocado.  That would have made it perfect.  I will be back!

-EB0IgoLJOJop_XkchdGyg.text: This place rocks! The food is quite different then the Mexican food I grew up on in South Phoenix. This place as become my all tie favorite Mexican restaurant. Food is great, the staff is awesome, nice and very friendly (they all seem to really enjoy their jobs) and the building itself is very clean. They now have a lifetime customer!

8YC7RQt-boIG1ipWpr41PQ.text: The bombest Tortas and Juego in Northside Phoenix....

pqhLIX13TABTfDLwTietXQ.text: This is some artery clogging bowel busting goodness. The big, juicy Amber Rose-esque torta del rey will make Yeezy jealous.  Meat, meat, and meat stacked up high. Paired with a cantaloupe aqua de fresca and you have a winner.  I'd only hoped that the chorizo was cooked a little more to a crisp, but with all that stuff piled on it's hard to notice.  Also, it's a mexican joint, no?  How about some tortilla chips instead of ruffles, or am I missing something?  That's like eating my pho w/ spaghetti.  But it's cheap and service is good and worth a stop just to experience the Man v Food tour.

8aiyDYKNJ7if4sswMm-QdA.text: Got take out of a chicken sandwich with chipotle and a steak sandwich with avocado ....bread is really good and both tasted amazing.  Definately going back soon.

dbix5dk4jIKoVb1shY3KdA.text: Thank heavens I came hungry. Eating just half of my Torta Nortena blasted every last hint of hunger out of my body for the rest of the day (and part of the next day).   The sandwiches didn't take long after we ordered, but the few minutes we had waiting at our table were filled with sweet horchata and Marc Anthony music videos.   When the food came, I could only manage to make it halfway through the Torta Nortena, which is a sandwich stuffed with thinly sliced beef, grilled onions, tomato, jalapenos, chipotle mayo, bubbly cheese and fresh avocado. It's a hot mess... and so good you'll WANT to get your hands (and your shirt/pants/neighbor) dirty.  My boyfriend ordered a shrimp ceviche tostada (very tasty) and the Torta de la Reyna, which was enormous and came with everything mine did... plus a zillion other things like chorizo, ham, what looked like a whole omelet, etc.   We used the Yelp app a lot while we were traveling, which is great when you're looking for something like "cheap Mexican food" because it brings you to neighborhoods you wouldn't normally check out while visiting. This is how we found Los Reyes de la Torta. I'm sure there are plenty of tourists flocking here after the Man vs. Food shout-out (we didn't know 'til we arrived), but it didn't feel the least bit touristy and I I liked that.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is only half of the torta de la reina.

DWfgi9xw1Qx5-lvkoRb_EA.text: Me and my girlfriend went here for the first time today and I must say this place was to darn good..i got the carne asada torta and its has been the best torta i have ever tasted..im sorry but tortas paquime has nothing on them..i also got the lime agua fresca and it was also really good

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne asada torta

Vy6tPXyjW2GukFXc2KnbgQ.text: First time visit for me today. I had the Del Ray, which was very good. The atmosphere was nice, and the staff was very friendly. I will definitely be back. The only downside I can think of is it was a bit loud due to being a busy Saturday, and the sound echoing off the concrete floor. Otherwise the experience was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Del Ray with chips.

v19D76CYGlABp-lyOLIGRg.text: Love the food here, very authentic. Quick and friendly waitresses. Great blended fruit drinks. But they really need to get something other than the iced tea that's worse than you'd get in prison

8H8xQG3NSfMZQJFvh-OOEg.text: Don't come here if you want to impress someone with ambiance. Come here if you want to eat GOOD Mexican food.  The Torta Ranchera is amaaazing. Their $.99 ceviche tostada is amaaazing. The auga frescas, the salsa, the beans, honestly everything they have here is really, really good, and consistently so.

z1EK3Qz-nc16ZY-WCibt0w.text: Awesome!  There are so many reviews here already for this location!  Here's my take on the visit, which occurred Saturday Jan 29.  After I convinced my 10year old that she might actually enjoy the unfamiliar (and get a fresh fruity drink), we stopped in at Los Reyes de la Torta for lunch.  We were seated quickly and a friendly young lady waited on us.  We needed a minute to look over the large selection of items, so she brought us water and gave us a couple minutes.  My daughter wouldn't order a torta, but said she'd try mine.  She selected a quesedilla with guac, and a Mango/Strawberry Aguas Cremosas, which is kinda like a lighter milk shake- not as heavy on the cream. The white cheese was melted and folded between a deliciously buttered and grilled flour tortilla.  Yum!  She enjoyed it, and the drink.  Based upon Rand's review, I ordered the "Torta Nortena" with salad.  Iced tea is fresh brewed and good.  The food arrived quickly and was plated beautifully.  This was truly the best Torta I have ever had.  The mix of ingredients was just right, and the bread was divine.  It was a little spicy for my daughter, but she loved the mix of flavors and suggested that the entire family come back for lunch next Saturday.    Servings are larges, so we took home 1/2 a Torta and a bunch of quesedilla, which were quickly consumed by a perpetually hungry teen, who now wants to go get her own Torta.  We enjoyed the atmosphere- lots of families, bustling and lots of energy.  Positive, happy crowd.  The restaurant is in an old-school strip center, but is clean and effort has been made to make the inside cheerful.  We watched some of the prep cooks working and I noted that they used proper safety/sanitation measures at all times.    I can't wait to go back and try some other variations.  My daughter is now a Torta convert.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta Norteña

kjiczjRt030n-ET_2MXKZw.text: Ate here with the wife and kids for the first time. Wow. We loved it! Nice casual atmosphere inside. My wife and I split a Torta and steak tacos. Both were excellent! My son had fish tacos...out of this world. This is perhaps my new favorite in the whole Phoenix metro area.

1paqXpgGcqIWUvtPAylA7w.text: Laura and I went in to Los Reyes de la Torta for lunch on our day off yesterday.  We were both really hungry as we hadn't ate all day and it was a good thing because I didn't even finish my plate.    I ordered the cantaloupe agua fresca and the tinga quesadilla.  The agua fresca was awesome full of flavor and even a very nice presentation.  I am a huge fan of chicken tinga so anyplace that serves it gets an A in my book.  This place is another perfect example of that.  The quesadilla  was awesome lots of meat inside along with a great sauce and cheese on the top.    This place rocks and I will be back for sure.  Laura even made the comment this is the first place she has ate at that makes her feel like back home in Mexico flavorwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LBBLrAzQdD8Ofz1UudFWtA.text: Amazing , very authentic.  The best shrimp tostada I have ever had. Best place to find by accident.

lCd8i3liVYEvaVP7acN_Wg.text: We love taking friends and family here when they visit Phoenix, as you simply don't come across gems like this on the East coast. They're known for their tortas, which are simply phenomenal, but they also have great options for breakfast. They don't have a liquor license, so there's no margaritas to pair with your massive sandwiches, but they do have a wide variety of fresh juice options. This place is super authentic and the staff is very friendly and quick to bring your food and top off your drinks.

m490eHH5IDT_mmPYiBFoQg.text: Definitely good food here. I've gone in 3-4 times and always gotten good service and good food. The tortas are large so be prepared to come in and get stuffed or order the "mini" version. Also the agua frescas with the fruit flavors are very good.

0gdL_f57fSzLuFh760so2w.text: What to say about this place? Great food, great service and the location is great if you like to hike North Mountain a lot :-)  I'm no expert with Tortas but this place has some amazing ones which will fill you up with lunch and dinner! Being a long time fan of Travel Channel's "Man vs Food" I've been meaning to try this place for some time now. Glad I did. Sure you will too.

gMBJfEEuzNit5-ncGXNIrQ.text: Oh yum, this place, as the other reviewers have raved is great.  Their definitely known for their tortas, but a great find in the pork loin tacos as well.  The server was a little surprised when they saw that I had ordered both those dishes.  I finished them both.  The Mexicana, carne asada torta, had fresh bread, good mix of avocados and sides making this a great mexican sandwich.  The carne asada was good.  The Pierna, pork loin tacos, were moist and just right.  Good amount of toppings and the salsa was a good addition to the street style tacos.  The aguas frescas, I had the papaya drink which was refreshing.

Pe8kJ-_tcz8iBZDd8J-LJw.text: Totally not what I was expecting but wow! So much flavor packed into my sandwich. This is one of my husband's favorite lunch spots. We will certainly be going back. I had leftovers and they were even good cold from the fridge he next day!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing!

pZrPaACMH5dxDgMkNc6tnw.text: Holy crap, these are massive sandwiches.  On the recommendation of my boss (who very obviously saw this on Man vs Food, despite his denials), I made my way over to this place to try one of their tortas.  The bread is fantastic.  Light, super soft, hearty enough to hold the sandwich together, crusty enough to give you a nice grip, while it doesn't bring much in flavor or texture, it absorbs so much of the flavors of the ingredients.  Usually a negative for me when the bread doesn't serve a bigger role, but when there is so much going on otherwise, I'll make an exception here.  I love the breaded beef.  The meat is super tender and there's a lot of flavor coming from either the breading or the beef (can't tell).  Also, the mexican sausage (not sure if it's just the chorizo) is good spicy.  In the portions they use relative to everything else, it balances out, but you get these nuggets of real heat - much appreciated.  I do wish the house guacamole had a bit more heat it to it, because as is, it acts more as a palette cooler.  Also... fried egg on a sandwich - not new, but  there's something super breakfasty about it in these tortas.  Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but there was a nagging feeling that I was eating breakfast.  Not that there's anything wrong with breakfast for lunch or dinner.  Ambiance inside is very casual and relaxed.  Wait staff weren't the friendliest and I often felt like I was waiting for them to finish their personal conversations.  Food came up fast.  Already looking forward to many future visits and many future tortas.

-gLcecfu_F9N3Lnok7uxUA.text: The food was decent, nothing spectacular about the food. I had a corn tortilla chicken quesadilla, it had the right amount of spice and flavor. I also got the Watermelon Aqua Fresca it was refreshing in the 100 plus  weather.   The service was why I gave the restaurant three stars. We had seven people in our group. We all ordered aqua Fresca's and it took over 10 minutes to get drinks to the table.  I never got the water I requested.  The food took a while as well and the waitress didn't really stop by to see if we needed anything else.

NZJKGuwMz6mPoBmY9jqJ-Q.text: I have been eating here for years. The food is excellent period. The reason for the 3 stars is recently the prices have gone up and portion size has gone down. One of the reasons i like Mexican food is you get a plate of food for a reasonable price. Now i look at my plate and think "you just got ripped off."

NTGmNxcU3rsyfho9sK__3Q.text: This place is pretty darn good! Now I consider myself a "Sonoran" style Mexican food gal and this is "Mexico City" style. So it is different. Party of 5, 2 adults and 3 kids. Seated right away by a beautifully sweet hostess who was super kind and helpful. The server was sweet and gave her recommendations. Took care of the refills and checked back often. We ordered a side of grilled shrimp (my kid loves shrimp) 12 shrimp for $5.50, that's a great price. A kids quesadilla with rice and beans (the beans were cold and the cheese on top was barely melted but had good flavor, the rice was okay and the quesadilla, well it's a tortilla with melted cheese, can't go wrong). Ordered a bean and cheese burrito with chips (choice of salad or chips with burros) The chips were Ruffles lol. Also ordered the Bistec Burro enchilada style with Red sauce( delicious steak and filled to the max, the red sauce was so good too, my only complaint was it wasn't very hot, barely warm, I want HOT food! Temperature hot) and finally tried the Rachero Torta with chicken (it was good but nothing special, although the guacamole was darn good) Overall, I would definitely eat here again and stick to the Burros, HUGE and delicious and maybe ask them to heat it up more. Good service and huge menu!

7Vfj34V2EWgpKuYnZ-ftpA.text: Absolutely delicious! Beef nachos to start. Chicken enchiladas for the husband.  Grilled shrimp fajita burrito for me.

9YpOMVXtqqAHNCCNZai0uw.text: I've been here several times and I must say each visit is as good as the last. The tortas are probably the best I've had in Phoenix(dare you to find better),they are pretty nice size, so be prepared to eat. Oh, yea lunch time gets crazy but it is worth the wait.

ijW3uuRYqnl35qOGFabyNg.text: I really love their food, from tacos to tortes and quesadilla, all delicious. My only complaint is they serve potato chips with the tortas, would be nice if they created their own side dish. Also the Fresas con crema and Aguas Fresca are yummy

QRaMem1OjmaNzj8cktOAzA.text: Found this on Yelp! Thank you!  Great food. Ordered the guac, a Torta mini, and a burro. Yum

Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta Del Pricipe-steak

idrxD2UxJx8Z0tJXEhOgdA.text: Not greatest place to get food in Phoenix, but definitely interesting. They had recently lost their liquor license so that was a bummer, but the good thing was that when I went, it was empty.  It was clean and the wait staff was very friendly. The food was good but nothing special. Only reason I came here was because I saw it on Man vs Food. They have a food challenge that's not anything to write home about. I think the best part of this place would probably the wait staff. I remember them being very kind and helpful, very fast and very nice.  If you're looking for something that's gunna blow your mind, this isn't it. It's great to go and try the food challenge or if you're in the mood for inexpensive decent food.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El Rey!

FGnqlmQ_LrPmDk1Yi7yHjA.text: Even an authentic Mexican restaurant is offering a mini, I love it! Don't come at peak lunch, the parking is limited and you'll wait. I arrived around 2pm. The atmosphere is also very authentic and is why I don't think I'll ever see a location in north Scottsdale, my neck of the woods. For the few, there is a torta with 5 lbs of meat. It's the Carlos V and costs $27, but if you eat it all in 15 minutes, it's free. There is a mini bar at this location that makes you feel like your in Mexico City.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A mini torta
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The traditional stuff on the menu

PMQH5bJjlHqzZDR-CQrwxw.text: Living near East Side San Jose in California, I have high expectations when it comes to Tortas and Mexican food for that matter.   However, I feel that Los Reyes rides on their fame of Man vs Food albiet their torta portions are massive. Nothing here was spectacular to me.  I ordered the Del Rey Torta, from the rave reviews and I do tend to get signature items from restaurants since it should be a representation of who they are. Along with the torta I ordered a horchata.  The Del Rey is a massive torta that easily feeds 2, a half for each person. It comes with a side of chips and in the torta itself it has: avocado, pickled onions, tomato, egg encasing chorizo, hotdog, then cheese, brisket, and fried steak. Bread barely held every thing in and was a huge mess.  The torta had lots of textures, flavor wasn't as flavorful and didn't seem to be cohesive. It was just a lot of meat, cooked different ways in between two slices of bread. The chorizo didn't have that lovely red color nor heat to it.  The horchata was plain chalky, powdering and doused in cinnamon powder on top.  I packed half of my torta home since I couldn't finish my meal, but didn't even end up eating it afterwards. I didn't finish my horchata.  Service is decent. Typical of a family run restaurant, casual but timely. Pricing was okay for what it was, though I would get Mexican food elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Del Rey Torta

gtSStAe0QkIDAIdgkGed7Q.text: I grew up in Yuma, so after moving here, I REALLY missed Mexican food. Found this place, and have gone back whenever I can! The sandwiches are large (one can definitely last me two meals), and cost around $11. The service has always been good, and I've definitely never left unsatisfied. I highly recommend it!!

OlUa2bCz1fT9LA8yO4gr1Q.text: Come HUNGRY !!!! They have very nice and sweet servers here who are attentive and happy. Their portions are very large here so plan on having a to go box ( unless you're my husband ) The drinks are Incredible  but non-alcoholic , there is O'Douls for those who just gotta have that flavor with a meal. I had the biggest quesadilla I've ever seen , with machaca , and they have lots of other kinds of meat to choose from to put inside this cheese filled dream. Their horchata is so rich and creamy. And the bill was not even close to other places I've been to lately, which left me leaving a great tip for my server and still a feeling of satisfaction , which I can have again later tonight because I went home with a togo box !

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We ordered the Torta del Reyes , his the big mine the small , and the mini ceviche tostada. WOW ‼ What A Lunch !!!!
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love this painting, Love this place.

_65Vwe3_xpDG0aRy5O9oEw.text: Don't waste you time, money, nor calories. Even the chips and sala were bland. Got the ceviche....terrible. 2 tortas and they were terrible. Worse tasting restaurant ever.

11SMvwedr6jhoqKgMNGHxQ.text: The tortas were so delish, kids enjoyed the mango agua fresca. Would def go back if I visit the area again.

yPWRXKEhhEb25k2dvg8ywA.text: Los Reyes De La Torta  This locally owned family restaurant serves up very authentic mexican food.  They are famous for their tortas and in particular the "Del Rey" which consists of - Ham, melted cheese, pork sirloin, breaded beef, sausage, chorizo and eggs with tomato, onions, jalapeno and avocado. This beast is about 8 inches tall and can barely bite into it. All the different items blend well with each other for $8.99  The Del Rey was featured in Man vs Food and is their staple but other items are very good also.  King Carlos V is the double version of the Del Rey and is brought out on a pallet for $19.99.  The tacos and burritos are also tasty and you will not leave feeling hungry.   We also have had the Mexican drinks aqua fresca which comes in a variety of flavors and which you can't go wrong.  But if you go here the tortas are what you come here for.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Del Rey Torta

JIGLUjeOkeZ6McyqghT4bQ.text: Just a simple straight forward review here.  Came in around 11 AM by myself for a quick lunch.  Ordered a mini shrimp ceviche tostada and mini torta norteno de res (carne asada).  Tostada came out within minutes and was perfection.  Cold, clean, fresh ceviche which was a perfect snack.  Torta came out piping hot and fresh.  Added some salsa and chopped jalapenos and it was perfection in my opinion.  Just a nice clean spicy torta.  Bill was $9 plus tip.    Highly recommend anytime

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mini torta norteno de res
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp ceviche tostada mini

jMTlUKOJpCjDbjy3HjM-6Q.text: Second time trying the restaurant.  They were busy but the wait was about 10 minutes.  The service  was slow . Tried two appetizers. Cheese crisp quick was very good. The hot sauce was tangy but not hot . Shrimp  cerviche was dry . We had three tortas.  Beef  was dry. Pork was good and the special was interesting conglomeration of multiple meats top with an egg. Beef was dry

9zVDZ4VHeiqluc9OTydKqg.text: Typically, I rate 5 parts of the restaurant including food (of course), but today I will only rate the food because truly, nothing else matters. (Having said that, the rating would be lower due to ambiance, cleanliness, etc.)   I have moved from AZ to FL. NO ONE here understands what Sazon is, nor what real Mexican flavors taste like. The blend of spice, acidity, sweet, and sour turns the food at Los Reyes into works of art for the mouth. I have NEVER had Tortas that taste so flavorful and I've been around authentic Mexican food for over 30 years.   How I miss you!...

_3D-WmcwX2fE4DVJEgfFIw.text: the food is really greasy and there is hardly any flavor to the salsa and the food .

c9nHJlovd-OC-jUvM51rhw.text: I honestly don't understand how this place is a 4 1/2 Star smh. This place was recommended to me by my cousin. I thought we'd give it a try since it wasn't too far from our home. I ordered a carne asada Torta, and was very disappointed by what they brought out. I've had other tortas at taco trucks that had better flavor. The torta they brought out was pretty much just carne asada they had cooked earlier that day and just cut it into half's. Smh not even fresh and it was cold. Overpriced Mexican food which shouldn't even be called Mexican food. Customer service was ok but it doesn't make up for the crappy food, and don't even get me started on the price of a torta it's laughable. Just because you're Location you put a bigger price on everything. I sincerely do not recommend if this place if you want authentic tortas and would really suggest changing the name of this place because they are not "Los Reyes de la Torta

MLTUKwgPioCcjOYeeAwLCA.text: Lol they have really milked that Adam Richman visit! Haha, but whateves this place is awesome!   Best Torta: Nortena   Price with a Drink: $13   Tip: I always order to go, this place is always packed and to go orders normally take anywhere from 10-15mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta Norteña

A4hnBQ2Lzhr4V9_3IALBBg.text: Family place that is basic mom and pop Mexican .. staff is friendly and quick.. even gave me a sample of a pork I was unfamiliar with.. had the chilaquiles half red (spicy) half green ( a light heat)  was so large could not finish.. had steak and eggs on the chilaquiles.!  Had several dishes I would like to try so would return if in the city.. the tortas are on my list next trip..

I2fFnQb1RNgHu35yWLJwww.text: This is authentic Hispanic food. They even had a dish my husband and I ate in Honduras. The rice is white rice with carrots and corn instead of the red rice served a lot of other places. I had the torta del Rey- it was delicious! T

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6gPsSBZ5ym1Mk0d-Vz0A7Q.text: I came here specifically for the Del Ray Torta. For getting five different types of meat, along with veggies and sauce, I was expecting better. There wasn't much of a flavor punch. Everything was very tame and washed out in distinction. The bread was decent and held up for the meal. The avocado was fresh and added a good amount of creaminess and moisture. Price wise, you're getting a good amount. I highly recommend splitting it.

qtZDRi-gxePSn1pNLZrKhw.text: Awesome authentic Mexican food ! A few tables inside -small place . I'd imagine this place getting packed at lunch hour .   We started with the tostada de ceviche and the tostada de tinga with guacamole- perfect . Next was Torta del principe and huaraches con tingo de pollo with grilled cactus . Portions are very big . The dinner was outstanding...the meat had great flavor . The torta came with a raw vegetable side and grilled onion/jalapeno. The cactus reminded me of string beans with more flavor . The table hot sauce was great and they also brought out a Verde sauce and a roja sauce - both awesome! Also ordered a horchata- yummy !   No alcohol served . Didn't try dessert but they sounded good . This restaurant beats out all of the uppity Mexican fusion/artisan/hipster/wannabe authentic places at triple the price . It's the real deal !

9FXtGhJjeuRs1CV7uyHibw.text: The carne asada tacos were excellent and a great value and the nortena de res o pollo (chicken torta) was pretty good too.  Good flavoring and spice kick on the tacos!

Ed3sdfjFfYDIyyMnUslAYA.text: Are you serious......love Mexican food and there are plenty good ones to choose from in AZ but had the Asada Burrito last night...out of this world.Best ever...the grilled jalapeno pepper and onion on the side are amazing but their sauce.....magic ,magic,magic:) Can't wait to eat there again...beyond delicious.

RPSRZQzDu1alx_Fy7lPrxg.text: I am going to repeat the EXACT words used when I took my first bite of food.....Stupid Good.  Yes that is the best I could pull out my expansive vocabulary.  This is, quite literally the best Mexican food I have had in my life.   I mean, most of the patrons of this fine establishment are Hispanic.  I always say, if the patrons of a restaurant match the ethnicity of the cuisine, EAT THERE!  The last thing I want to see in an Asian or Mexican or Thai restaurant is all white folk!!  I have been here several times, and nothing is bad. Even their home made juices are amazing. I constantly find myself ordering the V8.  I also love the Chorizo Fundito and the Massa Quesadilla is SOOOO GOOOD!

hscB1kaSd4zNLfU_4NSZhw.text: Outstanding fresh meals. Be prepared to have leftovers because the servings are generous. The menu has something for everyone and items you rarely find.

XqUXCLMfPrCieITiMi9t0g.text: One money symbol...?   Yeah hardly.  Lemonade ended up being 6 dollars.   Honestly the food tasted pretty good, but then I felt pretty sick for the rest of the night.  Would I come back? Probably not.   Ordered two meals, got one.   Ordered a simple lemonade, got an alcoholless margarita.   Not pleased.

kCo4hl5t_pVd6GN1-fvKaw.text: Walking in to Reyes was an experience for me. It's a busy little hole in wall in an unsuspecting mini strip mall where you're greeted by a flock of Spanish speaking hostesses. My blank stare must have communicated my intent; I was handed a menu as I was asked "to-go?"  Yes, that.   I moved away from Phoenix a few years ago and Austin doesn't have a decent torta place to its name. My usual go-to was on Arizona avenue, but I didn't feel like fighting the 51 this afternoon. So here I come Reyes!  My Arizona torta only took a few minutes to come out and I must have inhaled it back at my hotel. It was packed with meat, tomato, avocado, jalapeno...all the good things in life. I poured on the provided green salsa and went to town. It was 1pm and I didn't eat for the rest of the day. Couldn't! For fear of my stomach bursting. Good, filling, indulgent - everything I need in a torta.

YDF_XnfbTwCOAgq8uFD2VA.text: This place is....ok.  The service was great but the food was...meh.  Absolutely no liquor is served here.  No margueritas, no Carona, Pacifico.nothing.  So, if you wanna go so you can see what man vs food saw, then go.  I must need glasses.

yg-OGSDuyyTHUhJ1rcz4xg.text: What an excellent lunch I had here! Rand H. organized a little UYE for this place with Mike C., Robyn N., Arlin B. and myself. The establishment is in a rather cramped commercial strip but the restaurant itself is quite roomy, although it doesn't look it at first when you enter. I ordered a ceviche appetizer; this was the best ceviche I've ever had -- I would come here just for this! For my entree, I had the bistecas y huevos with rice and beans; it came with sides of avocado and Mexican cheese. I also had a refreshing glass of mango agua fresca which accompanied the meal perfectly. Great food, great prices, and great service even when the place is busy - no wonder this place is so popular.

Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bisteca y huevos

AE4xNqxrA3j8380ENP9lYA.text: The Mexican food Gods and Goddesses have possessed the mortal bodies of the people who work in the Los Reyes De La Torta kitchen to grace us with their magical food.   I swear every time I eat here I am transported to another realm of taste bud enchantment.  The servers are super sweet and kind. So casual yet so much "sabor!'. I love Los Reyes De La Torta.   I am still trying to figure out if it is the food that is soul shattering amazing, or that the fact that I watched Adam Richman devour a torta on Man Vs. Food made me love this place even more. I swear, there is nothing sexier than a man who loves to eat delicious food. I could watch Adam Richman all day omg... So freaking hot... Wow I'm so weird but whatever. This place is awesome, go check it out and gain a new addiction to your list!  Viva Los Reyes de La Torta!!

ccQQx3v0FsrME-tzFhTweQ.text: My girl friend turned me on to this spot and im glad she did. Great service. Awesome food. Awesome fresh fruit drinks. Good prices. We eat here atleast twice a month.

h0szF-3eghayZBW9hstOyg.text: Oh my God. Real authentic Mexican food. It is awesome. It's like a little hole in the wall place, but the food is to die for. We will come back when we visit the grandkids again.

IsyP92J7-Wmcf_AGuXgM-A.text: We really enjoyed our sandwiches and the service was great.  We felt like we were back in Mexico City.

WZqeCa3PjXLzi_CSVveQrg.text: This is definitely an authentic hole-in-the-wall place. The food was pretty good (we had tortas - they were good, but nothing to rave about), but the service was rushed and seemed a bit annoyed.

ozGzcMR1tGqFMfSjNppCWQ.text: Great food, so-so service. We're okay with benign neglect by waitstaff but we do attempt to reinforce the importance of compliance with dairy & wheat restrictions. The neglect of waitstaff in this instance extended to neglect to notify the kitchen of our restrictions resulting in two members of our party getting cheesy dishes despite repeated admonitions, as well as subsequently switching two dishes so that someone who wanted cheese didn't get it, and other, smaller infractions. It was likely part language barrier, part didn't give a $hit. Omnivores among the group loved this place.

dW0tEAtGW5GAqBFKjdpNFg.text: The Torta de Milanesa was good. Not the best, but decent. I also had a bite of my friends Torta Cubana and that was good, slightly better than my milanesa. My torta de milanesa had beans and no-where else have I ever had beans in a torta, atleast never in Mexico, place where the torta is king. But this might just be a filling replacing the standard avocado added to tortas de milanesa. Since I noticed that my torta lacked that and the avocado always gives it that extra creamy and tasty kick!!          Also, my standards are high for tortas. I've been lucky enough to enjoy tortas de Milanesa and Cubanas in Currnavaca and Mexico City by Tortas Che and others there!! Those are bomb!!! ANYWAYS!!          The tortas here are not bad, their simply good, but nothing that I would frequent nor crave. The service here was fantastic!!!! No complaints there, we were getting attention left and right, nothing overwhelming, just accommodating and super attentive.         The ONE THING I did love from this place was the Fresas con Crema!! Those were AMAZING!!! That is the reason why I came here in the first place. One of my friends had these exact Fresas con Crema at his place and he shared some with me to try and the Fresas con Crema and I fell in love ever since!!  OH YOU SWEET, SWEET, FRESAS CON CREMA with pieces of pecans!! :) You rock my taste buds!! :)       Yours truly,            Lizeth M. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious Fresas con Crema!! Yummy!
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Adam Richman approves, so then I must!! :)

pqpqOYWm4vGeuIXdDs4NTA.text: Ok, you want quick and amazing food that takes you to your childhood, even if you're not Mexican? Reyes de la Torta will do it.   I had always heard about this place from the youth I worked with. They said it was amazing. Once I went, I was hooked.   You're going to get a completely different feel from this place. Yeah, it's in a strip mall; yeah, the hostess may stick you and your party at a table smaller than you're accustomed to; Yeah, there is soccer playing on the TVs instead of the news; .. but the food will make you not care about any of those things. Plus, they are always playing Salsa, not loud or rambunctious, trumpet-filled music. This adds to the experience as it makes me feel like I may be somewhere resembling my homeland of Colombia.   When you're asked for your drink order, make sure you ask for one of their aguas frescas... translation: fresh juice. I always get the Agua Fresca de Limon. It reminds me of the limeade I drink when I am back home in Colombia - this drink makes the whole experience worth it.  The chips and salsa are good, although you might want to watch out with the salsa if you're not a spice fan.   Ok, the restaurant is named the king of the tortas ... and you ask what is a torta?? To Mexican people, a torta is sandwich of meat, vegetables and anything else they may throw on there made on a hamburger-style bun - and that is what they're famous for -  that is why Adam from Man vs Food went there. But, I have never had their tortas simply because at Reyes you will enter a homemade-tortilla heaven that is like nothing else. These tortillas are amazing, from their texture, to their slight greasiness, to their taste, they are the best tortillas I have ever had.   So, in order to continue to eat the best tortillas ever, I always get the chicken quesadilla. Yep, it's simple, but amazing. You can also choose to get it "Estilo del Rey" which means they top off your quesadilla with more cheese ( white cheese, not crappy, yellow, greasy cheese), sour cream and green onions. That in itself sends this quesadilla into the history books.   Do yourself a favor and check out a truly unique restaurant tucked away in a strip mall just south of Hatcher on 7th Street. Make your way up to Sunnyslope and see what the buzz is about.

3P6g_IyH6HfyX6Zxny1PtQ.text: I admit, I came to Los Reyes de la Torta because I saw it on Man vs. Food and the sandwiches looked awesome. Unfortunately, I did not have the stomach space to partake in the del rey, but I was able to enjoy the milanesa and a giant agua fresca.  My milanesa was great - loved the fresh bread and the thinly battered beef. I forgot what the bf had, but his was even better because it was more saucey. Beware of the free salsa because they are both SPICY!!  I think even better than the torta was the agua fresca. I had the fresa cremosa - strawberry milk and it was amazing! Oh yeah and they have Mexican cokes in bottles too.   The parking lot is a bit small, but there was a guy guiding people on where to park. He was really nice and told us not to park in the neighboring lot or we would get towed.

6yOT583Rr3m6v6WYP5yxlg.text: Food was ok not great. Service was slow. We got seated then 2 others got seated a few minutes after. They got their drinks and food before we got asked what to drink.  I will stick to getting my tortas where I've been going plus it's not as pricey as this place.

A_NYttl4c31oiB-xlx9Sxg.text: Our group of 7 were seated quickly on a Saturday night. This was our second visit. Our food was tasty and hot. Chips and salsa were not complimentary, but flavor of food hits beyond the spot...meaning our entrees exceeded everyone's expectations. We were all very satisfied with our meals. I had a mini USA Torta, on which I had added an over easy egg. The toasted roll for this tasty Mexican sandwich was excellent and the salsas were spicy and flavorful. Milly was our server and took excellent care of us throughout our visit. We will return again, as soon and often as we can.

u5OiBbWyY87yutt-5wI5_g.text: I had the Alambre de Camaron and hubby had the famous Del Rey.. delicious food and great service!! We'll be back soon. xx

9gfwP0qQBv1WZQvjcPgLVA.text: Authentic Mexican food from the Federal District. Fresh and delicious along with great service make this the place to go in the North Valley.

sCQKH2YPX5r-n5y-L3IhXA.text: Best place to get a torta!! Their ceviche tostadas are also really, really fresh and yummy! I highly recommend for authentic Mexico City style food.

Ma0xKI9B2jfLtH2jY3F6Iw.text: I got the Torta Mexicana and a lime agua frescas. I must have made the wrong choice in torta because it was pretty boring - the meat wasn't really seasoned, the avocado was just lumped on instead of spread evenly, and there were no beans like the menu says. I got it without jalapeno so maybe that would have made the difference but overall, I was pretty disappointed. Also, it was just the torta (only slightly larger than your average fast food burger) and a side of radish and cucumbers (???) that I didn't want and some cabbage/lettuce mix I put on my burger myself for over $7.  However, the agua frescas was DELICIOUS.  I would come back and try to make a better choice but overall, a pretty disappointing experience that left me unsatisfied and $12.50 poorer. You've steered me wrong, Man vs. Food guy.

7A7tDb0DQc3-UbSIbE8E6g.text: Highly recommend, totally satisfied, great customer service, respected wait time and the food was very good! First time, wont be my last. Wife and I enjoyed our experience and look forward to coming again. Both originally from California so don't know of many places however this is the best so far!

Gnvu8P24C9Zi-z7e13uNaA.text: Great food and service for breakfast ... crazy good grilled veggies (onions and peppers) with ham, rice, beans and corn tortillas. Build you own breakfast taco with some nice grilled jalapenos to add if you want.  Definitely will be back.

tFcOuGieh2LCjUyZW0CtYg.text: You can never go wrong with Los Reyes! Had the Del Ray Torta... wow. Can never finish the Torta, but I get it almost every time i've been. Have also had the Hawayana Torta which was delicious as well. Their fresh squeezed juices are amazing and refreshing. Always a pleasure to come back!

4u7MYMxpFNxhlG2VqzVUwQ.text: The best food I have ever put in my face .  We had shrimp ceviche tostada, shrimp tacos, and a shrimp dinner plate .   Words do not describe this. It's that's good .

SAjjlmuCndV9A08Yes37hg.text: This place was packed on a holiday Monday at 2pm!! Had a short 10 min wait. Ordered pina agua fresca to share.. Awesome! Had the shrimp app with the absolute best tasting ceviche I have ever had!! We ordered the beef king tacos and huaraches. Alot of awesome food!!  Friendly atmosphere.. Mexican music... Best bang for the buck!! Can't wait to bring my parents!  Autentico!!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Afwww7ekjFf6EYE2VYyTWQ.text: Does "Los Reyes de la Torta" translate to "gut bomb?" Because that's what I got there. The food tasted good but man, did my stomach not like me for it.  The boyfriend and I ordered the mushroom queso and a torta to share (these things are huge). I would not order the queso again. I guess we just didn't know what it was. We expected a queso dip for chips. We got a plate full of melted cheese that I guess you put into tortillas. It was difficult to manage and just not really what we wanted.  The torta was tasty, I'll give 'em that. But honestly, it could have been better. We got one with pineapple and chipotle mayo. Could have used more of both. The mayo was almost non-existent. But there was plenty of meat so even though we shared one torta we were more than stuffed walking out of there.   I would give it another shot but only if I was really, really hungry.

gut-zuelP3XgG2nD23rx_w.text: Here's what happened... I blacked out, got punched in the stomach and left with a few dollars less in my bank account.  It sounds terrible, I know, but it was my fault for eating too much. There were way too many things on the menu that I wanted to try so I ended up getting the Del Rey. That sandwich is F-ing loaded! I mean, I'm all about excess sometimes with my food, but this thing has almost everything that you could want from a Mexican joint overflowing in between two halves of bread. Ya only live once though so I went for it, and it was very delicious! I've seen a similar torta on No Reservations in Frisco, but never knew that there was one in the valley. I'm glad I got to try it! Now, because of Man vs Food, most people will only go for the Del Rey. I would like to vouch for the quesadillas there though; they were also excellent! Their salsas are great as well, I just wish they had tortilla chips to go with em! Oh, and did I mention the agua frescas?! Amazing!   It's a great little spot and I'm very glad that a tv show can help out local businesses the way that it does. I'm going to be moving a lot closer to Los Reyes, so I'll probably be in there more often in months to come.
